section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Affiliate" means a person that directly or indirectly, through one or more intermediaries, controls, is controlled by, or is under common control with a corporation subject to this subtitle.
"Control" has the meaning stated in § 7-101(c) of this article.
"Subsidiary" has the meaning stated in § 7-101(f) of this article.

text.section:
A nonprofit health service plan may not invest in or otherwise acquire an affiliate or subsidiary unless:
the affiliate or subsidiary is licensed by the Commissioner; or
the affiliate or subsidiary is majority owned by the nonprofit health service plan; and
the business of the affiliate or subsidiary is directly related to the operation of the nonprofit health service plan or the administration of a health benefits program.

section.section: The nonprofit health service plan shall file the statement of proposed action required under this subsection at least 60 days before the effective date of the proposed action.
The nonprofit health service plan may not engage in a proposed action described under paragraph (1)(i) through (iii) of this subsection unless the Commissioner approves the action in writing.
The Commissioner shall either approve or disapprove the proposed action within 60 days after the Commissioner receives the statement of proposed action.
The Commissioner shall approve a statement of proposed action under this section unless the Commissioner determines the proposed action is contrary to the public interest.

text.section: The Commissioner may authorize a corporation to comply with the law of its domiciliary jurisdiction if the corporation is domiciled in a jurisdiction that has adopted by statute or regulation provisions that limit the ownership and operation of an affiliate or subsidiary in substantially the same manner as provided in this section.

section.section: If an affiliate or subsidiary of a corporation regulated under this subtitle does not comply with this section, the Commissioner shall require the corporation to file a plan of divestiture or liquidation of the affiliate or subsidiary.

The plan of divestiture or liquidation:
shall state the reasons for noncompliance clearly;
shall provide the Commissioner with the information that the Commissioner considers necessary to approve the divestiture or liquidation; and
is proprietary and confidential commercial information under § 10-617(d) of the State Government Article.
Before a divestiture or liquidation under this section, the plan of divestiture or liquidation must be approved by the Commissioner.
Any action by the Commissioner under this section may be appealed in accordance with Title 2 of this article.
